51680.name: {cD{*en {cO{*f {cT{*he {cW{*inter {cW{*olves{w
description: {wT{*his end of the room leads to yet another fairly large sized
opening to the east.  Heavy movement can be sensed throughout this
central cavern.  {w

51692.name: {cD{*en {cO{*f {cT{*he {cW{*inter {cW{*olves{w
description: {wA {*recently slain animal lays on the ground, ready to be devoured.
Rustling and heavy panting reinforce thoughts that this area is also
inhabited.  {w

51697.name: {cC{*arved {cP{*assageway{w
description: {wT{*he passage continues to the east and west.  The walls here are
covered with strange symbols and markings.  {w

51668.name: {cB{*arbarian {cE{*ncampment{w
description: {wA{*ncient stalagmites hundreds of years old have been cleared out,
leaving a relatively flat surface for the barbarians to establish a
small camp.  Boulders, used as makeshift seats, have been placed here
around a small fire.  {w

51672.name: {cB{*arbarian {cE{*ncampment{w
description: {wB{*lood-stained spears and hammers lean up against the wall, and
tools are strewn about the floor.  It is not organized or well kept,
but functional.  Calcium deposits have also been extracted from
limestone rocks and collected into a small pile.  {w

51650.name: {cC{*ave {cE{*ntrance {cT{*o {cT{*he {cS{*tronghold{w
description: {wM{*oving the boulders to the side and digging through the snowpack,
an opening to a cave is revealed.  The cave is much bigger than it
appears from the outside having been concealed, and a short tunnel
going in only one direction lies ahead.  {w

51663.name: {cS{*torage {cA{*lcove{w
description: {wT{*his appears to be an artificially made storage area, which would
explain the pile of rocks in the other room.  It is not particularly
large, but serves its purpose by preventing access by any stray
creatures.  {w

51664.name: {cS{*torage {cA{*lcove{w
description: {wS{*mall wooden crates are tightly stacked up against the wall.  The
freezing temperatures provide for ideal storage for any number of
items.  {w

51687.name: {cD{*en {cO{*f {cT{*he {cW{*inter {cW{*olves{w
description: {wT{*his hollowed out area holds the bodies of several wolves, frozen
solid.  These would be the weaker wolves that have been weeded out by
the rest of the pack.  {w

51673.name: {cS{*outhern {cP{*assageway
description: {wT{*his tunnel is wide, but not particularly high, requiring anyone
who wants to get through to get on their knees and through.  Just
further to the south there appears to be a bend in the passageway
heading east.  {w

51652.name: {cE{*ntry {cC{*hamber{w
description: {wA {*large open-aired cavern offers an unobstructed view of the inside
of {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's {cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{*.  On the ground are indications that this cave may
be inhabited.  Piles of animal bones are strewn about, and wooden logs
lay randomly on the cavern floor.  There are openings, large and
small, heading in all directions.  {w

51677.name: {cM{*ain {cC{*avern{w
description: {wT{*o south is a naturally formed rock bridge leading to an exit.
Below the bridge are clusters of gypsum flowers , giving off an eerie
luminescent glow.  {w

51666.name: {cE{*astern {cT{*unnel{w
description: {wT{*his appears to be a major artery in the network of surrounding
tunnels.  Just a short distance to the east is a large open cavern,
while to the west is the entrance to the cave.  {w

51669.name: {cB{*arbarian {cE{*ncampment{w
description: {wS{*labs of dried meat are spiked into the soft limestone, hanging to
dry.  Strips of grisly fur covered skin have been carelessly tossed on
the ground.  Though unsanitary, it makes little difference in
temperatures as cold as this.  {w

51693.name: {cI{*nner {cS{*tronghold{w
description: {wT{*he passageway opens up to a medium sized cave that's been
converted to some sort of inner sanctum for this barbarian tribe.  It
well lit with numerous torches placed on the walls.  The only exit
from this room is to the south.  {w

51684.name: {cD{*en {cO{*f {cT{*he {cW{*inter {cW{*olves{w
description: {wE{*ndless streaks of frozen blood can be seen across the floor
leading to small alcoves to the east and south.  Many creatures have
found their final resting place here.  {w

51659.name: {cM{*ajor {cS{*ide {cC{*hamber{w
description: {wC{*rude handmade tools, which could double as weapons, lean up
against the wall here.  They have started to deteriorate and are also
covered with a layer of ice.  {w

51682.name: {cS{*outheast {cJ{*unction{w
description: {wT{*he passages continue to spread out in different directions, but
they don't appear to go any deeper into the mountain.  Tunnels lead
north and west, and a steep decline can be see to the south.  {w

51674.name: {cD{*en {cO{*f {cT{*he {cW{*inter {cW{*olves{w
description: {wT{*his room seems like an open graveyard with gnawed animal bones
stacked about a foot high on the ground.  With such a large collection
, it would appear this is a den of some sort.  {w

51661.name: {cM{*ajor {cS{*ide {cC{*hamber{w
description: {wA {*decent sized quarry of rocks lie on the floor here.  They seem a
bit odd and out of place, surely they were placed here on purpose.
This is the first indication that intelligent creatures must inhabit
this cavern.  {w

51690.name: {cI{*nner {cS{*tronghold{w
description: {wU{*nlike the rest of the cavern, this area has been meticulously
refined.  The walls are smooth, and a low rock outcropping has been
sanded down and polished.  Though not overly ornate, a lot of work has
been put into cleaning out this area.  {w

51667.name: {cM{*ain {cC{*avern{w
description: {wE{*ntering this cavern, a 40 foot column laced with selenite extends
from the floor of the cavern to the top, forming an impressive pillar
of support.  A light glow can be seen around the column on either
side.  {w

51681.name: {cS{*outheast {cP{*assage
description: {wT{*his passage appears to have been artificially widened to
accommodate something about the size of a small ogre.  It continues to
the east.  {w

51671.name: {cB{*arbarian {cE{*ncampment{w
description: {wT{*his area is covered with layers of large fur pelts which the
barbarians use for bedding.  A nauseating stench emanates from the
pelts that many couldn't stomach in passing, more or less spend the
night in.  {w

51688.name: {cI{*nner {cS{*tronghold{w
description: {wA {*cache of supplies for Jurram's personal use are here, including a
few weapons, a crate of food, extra torches, and extra fur pelts.  The
barbarians here subsist on the bare necessities for survival.  {w

51689.name: {cI{*nner {cS{*tronghold{w
description: {wF{*ive torches have been placed on the wall in a pentagram array, and
inside the pentagram are undecipherable writings more strange symbols.
This appears to be a primitive shrine for the god they worship,
whoever that may be.  {w

51694.name: {cI{*nner {cS{*tronghold{w
description: {wA {*large sculpture, carved from a single piece of rock, stands here.
It is about the size of an human and heavily adorned with rhinestones,
crystal, and other gems.  The head of the sculpture has a dragonlike
resemblance.  {w

51678.name: {cB{*end {cI{*n {cT{*he {cS{*outhern {cP{*assageway{w
description: {wR{*ounding the bend the passage widens towards the east and blends
into another cavern.  In that direction there appears to be movement
in the shadows, and faint rustling noises.  Something is there...  {w

51676.name: {cB{*arbarian {cE{*ncampment{w
description: {wW{*ith the freezing temperatures, a most unusual sight is seen on the
ground here.  A small vadose flow makes it's way along the edge,
providing a source of water in these extreme temperatures.  It is warm
to the touch, highly unusual, perhaps even magical in nature.  {w

51665.name: {cS{*torage {cA{*lcove{w
description: {wT{*his part of the alcove contains numerous fur pelts of all colors
and sizes.  They are both stacked on top of one another on the ground,
and hanging from taught ropes strung across the room where newly
skinned pelts are stretched and dried.  {w

51685.name: {cD{*ownward {cS{*lope{w
description: {wT{*his sharp decline descends further down into the mountain.
Footholds have been carved into the floor, and makeshift handhold have
been chiseled into the side walls.  {w

51695.name: {cI{*nner {cS{*tronghold{w
description: {wT{*he limestone flooring has been chipped out to make baseholds for
three wooden posts which have been driven into the ground here.  The
posts have been carved and painted with more strange markings to
create a set of idols with odd expressions.  {w

51691.name: {cC{*arved {cP{*assageway{w
description: {wT{*his passageway was carved out by hand, and judging by the
dimensions, was made for something larger than the average human.  It
continues towards the north and south.  {w

51657.name: {cC{*hamber {cJ{*unction{w
description: {wA {*narrowing throughway forms a natural doorway, joining the two
side chambers to each other.  Small rock outcroppings jut out, which
would have been removed if this were a high traffic passageway.  {w

51651.name: {cS{*hort {cT{*unnel{w
description: {wT{*he tunnel burrows into the mountain in a straightforward
direction.  As the cave swallows more of the natural sunlight with
each step, the cold black surroundings become almost disorienting.  {w

51655.name: {cM{*inor {cS{*ide {cC{*hamber{w
description: {wS{*mall stalactites hang down from the ceiling capped off with
icicles.  There is nothing particularly special about this corner of
the room.  {w

51679.name: {cD{*en {cO{*f {cT{*he {cW{*inter {cW{*olves{w
description: {wT{*he western end of this cavern carries a light draft, dropping the
freezing temperatures even further.  Directly to the west the room
narrows to a low passageway and an exit out.  {w

51658.name: {cM{*ajor {cS{*ide {cC{*hamber{w
description: {wT{*his area does not appear to be frequently used.  There are more
piles of animal feces on the ground and the air carries a heavy musty
smell.  {w

51696.name: {cC{*arved {cP{*assageway{w
description: {wT{*he passage takes a sharp turn and bends around the corner.  Low
burning torches continue to light the way.  {w

51683.name: {cD{*en {cO{*f {cT{*he {cW{*inter {cW{*olves{w
description: {wA {*pack of large wolves occupy this room, which are startled at the
sight of intruders into their den.  This is perhaps not the safest
room to be in.  {w

51660.name: {cM{*ajor {cS{*ide {cC{*hamber{w
description: {wP{*iles of bones and shredded animal carcasses litter the floor.
Fissures on the ground in this corner of the chamber make this area
impractical for any other use.  {w

51653.name: {cN{*orthern {cC{*rawlspace{w
description: {wT{*he opening to the north requires cautious navigation.  An upwards
slope, combined with an ice covered surface, requires sure footing to
avoid sliding down the surface back to the entry chamber.  {w

51675.name: {cD{*en {cO{*f {cT{*he {cW{*inter {cW{*olves{w
description: {wM{*ore splintered animal bones litter the floor here, requiring
careful foot placement to avoid falling onto what amounts to a
veritable bed of spikes.  {w

51662.name: {cM{*ajor {cS{*ide {cC{*hamber{w
description: {wT{*he corner of the room contains disorganized piles of rubbish and
other junk.  Peering upwards there is an opening leading to what
appears to be another room.  {w

51670.name: {cM{*ain {cC{*avern{w
description: {wT{*he spongework walls of the northwest corner of the room rise up
from the floor of the cavern all the way up to the top.  Hues of red,
orange, and yellow form an intricate pattern only nature could create.
It is truly a magnificent sight.  {w

51686.name: {cU{*pward {cS{*lope{w
description: {wT{*he bottom of a steep slope takes you deeper into the mountain.  To
the south is a corridor that obviously was not naturally created.  Low
flame torches along the sides light the path.  {w

51656.name: {cM{*inor {cS{*ide {cC{*hamber{w
description: {wT{*he far corner of the chamber holds a large pile of wood of all
sizes.  Small piles of bones and animal feces are visible on the
ground, confirming that these caves are indeed inhabited.  {w

51654.name: {cM{*inor {cS{*ide {cC{*hamber{w
description: {wT{*his naturally formed smaller cavern has walls made of
mineral-laced rock, covered by a thin layer of ice.  There is an eerie
silence, and the shadows seem to move.  {w

51650.name: {*a {WC{yrag {WC{yat{w ~
description:
{wTwo large teeth protrude down from the roof the crag cat's mouth.  
An iridescent glow shines in the cat's eyes as it pounces on you!{w
51650.room_name: {*A {WC{yrag {WC{yat{w {*silently prowls in the shadows, hunting for prey.{w

51651.name: {*a {WW{winter {WW{wolf{w ~
description:
{wThis wolf in enveloped by a coat of fur as white as the purest snow.    
It's ears twitch as it detects movement and smells an unfamiliar scent.{w

51652.name: {*a {WG{wre{*a{wte{Wr {WW{winter {WW{wolf{w ~
description:
{wThis wolf is much larger than the majority of the pack, with a more dense coat, 
larger teeth, and thicker muscles.  It's pitch black eyes are focused and unflinching.{w
subroutines:
F off FH
F for G

51653.name: {*a {BF{br{Wo{bs{Bt {BB{ba{*r{Wba{*ri{ba{Bn{w ~
description:
{wThis large humanoid with a wild look in his eyes does not seem to 
appreciate the fact that you have entered his domain.  He's large, dirty, and upset.{w

51654.name: {BJ{bu{Wrr{ba{Bm{w ~
description:
{wJurram is the ruler of the barbarians and oversees the stronghold.  His 
balding head and bushy beard complement his posture and stature among 
his people.  He holds a mace with a large bone handle and obsidian head in 
his hand, and he certainly knows how to use it.{w
51654.room_name: {*{BJ{bu{Wrr{ba{Bm{*, the leader of the frost barbarians stands here, wrapped in a {Wf{wu{Wr{* cloak.{w

51655.name: {*an {BE{bl{*i{bt{Be {BF{br{Wo{bs{Bt {BB{ba{*r{Wba{*ri{ba{Bn{w ~
description: {wAs one of the larger and more gifted barbarian warriors, he has been one of the chosen to protect Jurram.{w
51655.room_name: {*A large {BE{bl{*i{bt{Be {BF{br{Wo{bs{Bt {BB{ba{*r{Wba{*ri{ba{Bn{* keeps watch to protect Jurram.{w
